segment.source: Plan Your Migration (Windows 10)
segment.target: Plan Your Migration (Windows 10)

segment.source: Plan Your Migration
segment.target: Plan Your Migration

segment.source: Plan Your Migration
segment.target: Plan Your Migration

segment.source: Before you use the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to perform your migration, we recommend that you plan your migration carefully.
segment.target: Before you use the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to perform your migration, we recommend that you plan your migration carefully.

segment.source: Planning can help your migration proceed smoothly and can reduce the risk of migration failure.
segment.target: Planning can help your migration proceed smoothly and can reduce the risk of migration failure.

segment.source: In migration planning, both organizations and individuals must first identify what to migrate, including user settings, applications and application settings, and personal data files and folders.
segment.target: In migration planning, both organizations and individuals must first identify what to migrate, including user settings, applications and application settings, and personal data files and folders.

segment.source: Identifying the applications to migrate is especially important so that you can avoid capturing data about applications that may be phased out.
segment.target: Identifying the applications to migrate is especially important so that you can avoid capturing data about applications that may be phased out.

segment.source: One of the most important requirements for migrating settings and data is restoring only the information that the destination computer requires.
segment.target: One of the most important requirements for migrating settings and data is restoring only the information that the destination computer requires.

segment.source: Although the data that you capture on the source computer may be more comprehensive than the restoration data for backup purposes, restoring data or settings for applications that you will not install on the destination system is redundant.
segment.target: Although the data that you capture on the source computer may be more comprehensive than the restoration data for backup purposes, restoring data or settings for applications that you will not install on the destination system is redundant.

segment.source: This can also introduce instability in a newly deployed computer.
segment.target: This can also introduce instability in a newly deployed computer.

segment.target: Determine What to Migrate
